trans-unit.source: What's New in the Azure SDK 2.1 Release (July 2013)
trans-unit.target: What's New in the Azure SDK 2.1 Release (July 2013)

trans-unit.source: The <token>sb1</token> July 2013 release contains a number of new features and capabilities.
trans-unit.target: The <token>sb1</token> July 2013 release contains a number of new features and capabilities.

trans-unit.source: This topic summarizes the new features and contains links to more information.
trans-unit.target: This topic summarizes the new features and contains links to more information.

trans-unit.source: Paired Namespaces
trans-unit.target: Paired Namespaces

trans-unit.source: For detailed information about paired namespaces and high availability, see the new topic <link xlink:href="cda0f486-509f-46af-bb3a-6a3c48c8b040" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Asynchronous Messaging Patterns and High Availability</link>.
trans-unit.target: For detailed information about paired namespaces and high availability, see the new topic <link xlink:href="cda0f486-509f-46af-bb3a-6a3c48c8b040" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Asynchronous Messaging Patterns and High Availability</link>.

trans-unit.source: Sometimes, due to short-lived or transient outages, when a <token>sb2</token> <token>servicensd</token> becomes unavailable you are unable to send or receive messages to the namespace hosting the queue, topic, or subscription.
trans-unit.target: Sometimes, due to short-lived or transient outages, when a <token>sb2</token> <token>servicensd</token> becomes unavailable you are unable to send or receive messages to the namespace hosting the queue, topic, or subscription.

trans-unit.source: Previously, the typical workaround was to set up a separate namespace that can act as a backup, then implement extensive failover and retry logic.
trans-unit.target: Previously, the typical workaround was to set up a separate namespace that can act as a backup, then implement extensive failover and retry logic.

trans-unit.source: For more robust high availability, <token>sb2</token> now supports <newTerm>Paired Namespaces</newTerm>, which enables you to connect two namespaces.
trans-unit.target: For more robust high availability, <token>sb2</token> now supports <newTerm>Paired Namespaces</newTerm>, which enables you to connect two namespaces.

trans-unit.source: When you activate the secondary namespace, messages are stored in the secondary queue for delivery to the primary queue at a later time.
trans-unit.target: When you activate the secondary namespace, messages are stored in the secondary queue for delivery to the primary queue at a later time.

trans-unit.source: If the primary container (namespace) becomes unavailable for some reason, automatic failover enables the messages in the secondary queue to be delivered to the primary queue.
trans-unit.target: If the primary container (namespace) becomes unavailable for some reason, automatic failover enables the messages in the secondary queue to be delivered to the primary queue.

trans-unit.source: This feature is called <newTerm>Send Availability</newTerm>, which enables a single sender to continue to process messages in the event that one of the new namespaces encounters a messaging entity that becomes unavailable.
trans-unit.target: This feature is called <newTerm>Send Availability</newTerm>, which enables a single sender to continue to process messages in the event that one of the new namespaces encounters a messaging entity that becomes unavailable.

trans-unit.source: When the primary entity is unavailable, messages are sent to the secondary entity.
trans-unit.target: When the primary entity is unavailable, messages are sent to the secondary entity.

trans-unit.source: Set the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.SendAvailabilityPairedNamespaceOptions.EnableSyphon</codeEntityReference> property to <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword> on cloud service worker roles (backend processing), not on Web sites and Web roles (frontend processing).
trans-unit.target: Set the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.SendAvailabilityPairedNamespaceOptions.EnableSyphon</codeEntityReference> property to <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword> on cloud service worker roles (backend processing), not on Web sites and Web roles (frontend processing).

trans-unit.source: Note that syphons from secondary to primary do not preserve message ordering.
trans-unit.target: Note that syphons from secondary to primary do not preserve message ordering.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: Azure Tools for Visual Studio Changes
trans-unit.target: Azure Tools for Visual Studio Changes

trans-unit.source: In this release, the Azure Tools for Visual Studio contain enhancements and changes to the management of <token>sb2</token> messaging entities using Server Explorer.
trans-unit.target: In this release, the Azure Tools for Visual Studio contain enhancements and changes to the management of <token>sb2</token> messaging entities using Server Explorer.

trans-unit.source: The most noticeable change is that the <embeddedLabel><token>sb2</token></embeddedLabel> node is now integrated into the <embeddedLabel>Azure</embeddedLabel> node.
trans-unit.target: The most noticeable change is that the <embeddedLabel><token>sb2</token></embeddedLabel> node is now integrated into the <embeddedLabel>Azure</embeddedLabel> node.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="1ce0960d-84ae-410f-bc6d-fd231ca46931" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Browsing Service Bus Resources with the Visual Studio Server Explorer</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="1ce0960d-84ae-410f-bc6d-fd231ca46931" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Browsing Service Bus Resources with the Visual Studio Server Explorer</link>.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, there has been a change to the code generated by the <embeddedLabel>Azure Worker Role with Service Bus Queue</embeddedLabel> project template.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, there has been a change to the code generated by the <embeddedLabel>Azure Worker Role with Service Bus Queue</embeddedLabel> project template.

trans-unit.source: This code now uses an event-driven “message pump” programming model using the <codeEntityReference>M:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.QueueClient.OnMessage(System.Action{Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage})</codeEntityReference> method.
trans-unit.target: This code now uses an event-driven “message pump” programming model using the <codeEntityReference>M:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.QueueClient.OnMessage(System.Action{Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage})</codeEntityReference> method.

trans-unit.source: For example, the project type generates the following template:
trans-unit.target: For example, the project type generates the following template:

trans-unit.source: <token>crdefault</token> the “Event-Driven Message Programing Model” section in <link xlink:href="757c9c0a-3eeb-4450-9e39-1a29f2a40d12" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">What's New in the Azure SDK 2.0 Release (April 2013)</link>.
trans-unit.target: <token>crdefault</token> the “Event-Driven Message Programing Model” section in <link xlink:href="757c9c0a-3eeb-4450-9e39-1a29f2a40d12" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">What's New in the Azure SDK 2.0 Release (April 2013)</link>.

trans-unit.source: Azure Notification Hubs
trans-unit.target: Azure Notification Hubs

trans-unit.source: In this release, Azure supports Notification Hubs as part of the Azure SDK 2.1, in the Microsoft.ServiceBus.dll assembly.
trans-unit.target: In this release, Azure supports Notification Hubs as part of the Azure SDK 2.1, in the Microsoft.ServiceBus.dll assembly.

trans-unit.source: You can now create, update and delete notification hubs programmatically, manage your device registrations, and send push notifications to all your mobile clients across all platforms (Windows Store, Windows Phone 8, iOS, and Android).
trans-unit.target: You can now create, update and delete notification hubs programmatically, manage your device registrations, and send push notifications to all your mobile clients across all platforms (Windows Store, Windows Phone 8, iOS, and Android).

trans-unit.source: Learn more about notification hubs on MSDN in the <legacyLink xlink:href="27c514b4-3bc4-4ac2-9008-f384ea702821" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Notification Hubs Overview</legacyLink> topic, or watch the notification hubs //BUILD/ presentation <externalLink><linkText>here</linkText><linkUri>http://channel9.msdn.com/Events/Build/2013/3-515</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: Learn more about notification hubs on MSDN in the <legacyLink xlink:href="27c514b4-3bc4-4ac2-9008-f384ea702821" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Notification Hubs Overview</legacyLink> topic, or watch the notification hubs //BUILD/ presentation <externalLink><linkText>here</linkText><linkUri>http://channel9.msdn.com/Events/Build/2013/3-515</linkUri></externalLink>.
